<@UB87A2MJ7>: Hi, I'd like to ask a question! Please check the details.
*Question title:* `Free Addon details on order confirmation email`
*Topic:* `Adding a new feature/capability`
*Details:* `Hi team!
We are discovering the work required for adding free 4life addons details on order confirmation email (original ticket <https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/NVS-530>).
We got an information that there is a static list of vouchers that provide this benefit. Could you please help me to understand where is this list stored, how does it get updated?`

*Category:* squad-nv-good-chop
*Command:* goodchop-question

_thread_replies.text: Just for context, looping in <@U047SAC2PPV> as he got the information from one of the engineers. Our assumption is that we we can utilise the F4L voucher in order get this information which can be used in the Order confirmation email. We need to understand how do we get the list of vouchers who creates and manages this part as there is a way this can be handled by CRM later to include this information. Correct me if I am wrong here <@U047SAC2PPV>?!

elements.text: as he got the information from one of the engineers. Our assumption is that we we can utilise the F4L voucher in order get this information which can be used in the Order confirmation email. We need to understand how do we get the list of vouchers who creates and manages this part as there is a way this can be handled by CRM later to include this information. Correct me if I am wrong here

_thread_replies.text:
correct. I was talking to <@U03EN3N4KM4> yesterday and she mentioned that F4L users are converted with a set of vouchers. basically if a user converts with one of these specific vouchers, they're gonna get a F4L addon.

One of the solutions that we are thinking about right now, is to use these vouchers to detect if a user has a F4L addon or not

elements.text:
yesterday and she mentioned that F4L users are converted with a set of vouchers. basically if a user converts with one of these specific vouchers, they're gonna get a F4L addon.

One of the solutions that we are thinking about right now, is to use these vouchers to detect if a user has a F4L addon or not

_thread_replies.text:
I don't think there's a specific list of vouchers we keep, but the way we maintain FFL is by generating the free add-on SKU in CCM, and linking those SKUs to a specific voucher prefix in CUI (this part is manual, might not be 100 accurate).
Here's the list that we maintain:
<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/14p5tKaGb2v-KVnnj16GhHYVhncEdBeVPOIHvDwBA5TQ/edit?gid=0#gid=0>

_thread_replies.text: Hey team, actually the main goal of the change here is to get rid of hardcoded vouchers to detect if there is a F4L or not.

elements.text: Hey team, actually the main goal of the change here is to get rid of hardcoded vouchers to detect if there is a F4L or not.

_thread_replies.text: All F4L vouchers have a specific benefit type "free-addon", which we could use to detect if it's a free benefit or not

_thread_replies.text: <@U018UCEFJ65> /resolved

Hey team :wave:
We’ve finally mapped out all the work needed for this task and documented the preferred solution <https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TNV/pages/5487132905/NV-CRM+4life+addons+in+Order+Confirmation+E-mail#Option-2.1%3A-Add-information-to-checkout-event%E2%80%99s-metadata-field-%5BSELECTED%5D|here>.

To implement the changes on our end, we’ll need the frontend updates to happen first. We’ve already created an epic with the related <https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/NVS-622|frontend task>. Feel free to either create a new ticket on your board or move the existing one to your Jira project, whichever works best for you.

Can we make sure this is included in the next sprint?
 cc <@U027201FQSV> <@U07VDFEFBQU>

Thanks in advance!

elements.text: Owned by: Vinicius Fernandes de Jesus | 18 comments | 13 people viewed
